travel.desc: An act of traveling from one place to another.
The place to which someone or something is going or being sent.
Travel through (an unfamiliar area) in order to learn about it.
A long journey involving travel by sea or in space.
An unusual and exciting, typically hazardous, experience or activity.
An official document issued by a government, certifying the holder's identity and citizenship and entitling them to travel under its protection to and from foreign countries.
A thing that is kept as a reminder of a person, place, or event.
Plan and direct the route or course of a ship, aircraft, or other form of transportation, especially by using instruments or maps.
A short journey or trip, especially one engaged in as a leisure activity.

kitchen.desc: An implement with a broad, flat, blunt blade, used for mixing, spreading, and lifting.
A utensil for whipping eggs or cream.
A perforated bowl used to strain off liquid from food, especially after cooking.
A large long-handled spoon with a cup-shaped bowl, used for serving soup, stew, or sauce.
A device having a surface covered with holes with sharp edges for grating cheese and other foods.
Work (moistened flour or clay) into dough or paste with the hands.
Stay just below the boiling point while being heated.
Fry (food) lightly and then stew it slowly in a closed container.
Cut (food or other matter) into small cubes.
Cut up or grind (food, especially meat) into very small pieces.

human body.desc: Each of the small bones forming the backbone or spine.
The part of the body between the neck and the abdomen; the chest.
The part of the body between the chest and the pelvis.
A muscle on the front of the upper arm.
The thighbone; the longest and strongest bone in the human body.
The transparent layer forming the front of the eye.
The windpipe; the tube through which air passes to the lungs.
The tube connecting the pharynx and stomach.
A short band of tough tissue connecting bones or holding organs in place.
A tissue in the body that has the ability to contract, producing movement.

emotions.desc: Feeling or expressing great happiness and triumph.
A feeling of pensive sadness, typically with no obvious cause.
Feeling worry, nervousness, or unease about something.
Very happy or proud; in high spirits.
A feeling that someone or something is worthless; scorn.
Annoyed or frustrated to the point of anger.
Sentimental longing for the past, typically for a period or place with happy associations.
Regret and repentance for past actions.
A state of intense happiness and confidence.
